item.title: Thrust Reverser Systems and REV Unlock Indications

numlitem.para: Associated reverser is secured in the forward thrust position, and
On associated engine, both T/R Control and T/R Indication circuit breakers are opened and collared.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Thrust Reversers are deactivated and cannot be used. The REV amber indication may be displayed. Use Symmetrical reverse as required.

The thrust reverser deactivation will not affect control of engine idle speed during flight but the affected engines will stay in minimum idle on the ground. Therefore, EICAS message IDLE DISAGREE may be annunciated during landing when the unaffected engines are commanded to approach idle for reverse thrust operation.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Takeoff on cluttered or icy runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ REVERSER INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the associated Thrust Reverser:

warning.para: this deactivation procedure is mandated by faa airworthiness directive 2000-17-06 and faa airworthiness directive 2003-16-16; this procedure can not be changed unless directed by boeing, the faa and ups powerplant engineering.

DEACTIVATION OF THE THRUST REVERSER SYSTEM WILL BE PROPERLY ACCOMPLISHED WHEN ALL STEPS SHOWN IN THESE PROCEDURES ARE FOLLOWED. DEVIATIONS TO THESE PROCEDURES, OR CHANGING THE SYSTEM CONFIGURATION, MAY RESULT IN IMPROPER DEACTIVATION AND UNCOMMANDED DEPLOYMENT OF THE REVERSER.

numlitem.para: Open, collar, and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE identifiers to the P6 panel ENG START CONTROL circuit breaker and the following circuit breakers for the associated engine:
Engine 1: ENG 1 T/R IND and ENG 1 T/R CONT
Engine 2: ENG 2 T/R IND and ENG 2 T/R CONT
Engine 3: ENG 3 T/R IND and ENG 3 T/R CONT
Engine 4: ENG 4 T/R IND and ENG 4 T/R CONT
Open the fan cowl panels (Ref AMM 71-11-04/201).
Remove the two bolts securing the lockout plate over the lower CDU manual drive pad and remove the plate (two places).
Do the Thrust Reverser Electro-Mechanical Brake and Flexshaft - Adjustment/Test procedure (Ref AMM 78-34-07/501). Leave fan cowls open upon completion of test.
Stow the thrust reverser halves (Ref AMM 78-31-00/201).

(Optional procedure) Remove one, two or three red deactivation plates from the lower torque box of each reverser half. Install the plate(s) on the lock point(s) on each reverser half with bolts (two bolts per deactivation plate). It may be necessary to drive the CDUs or the angle gearboxes at the manual drive pads to align the holes in the brakes (if installed) must be manually released to drive the CDUs or angle gearboxes (Ref AMM 78-31-00/201).

note.para: The Lock points are marked with the stencil LOCK POINTS.

numlitem.para: At both CDUs, install the lockout plate with the square drive inserted into the manual drive pad. Tighten bolts to 24-27 pound-inches.
(FADEC) Verify that thrust reverser position feedback sensors (RVDTs) on both CDUs are properly installed and rigged as follows:
Apply ground test power to EEC.
Verify that thrust reverser position (T/RR, T/RL, Channels A and B) reads between -2% and +2% on the EICAS EPCS page.
If required, re-rig the RVDT (AMM 78-34-10/501).

caution.para: DO NOT DISCONNECT THE RVDT ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR FOR DISPATCH. A DISCONNECTED RVDT MAY RESULT IN UNCOMMANDED REDUCTION OF THRUST IN FLIGHT.

numlitem.para: Return the CDU brake release handles and, if installed, the elctro-mechanical brake release handles to the normal, brake engaged position (Ref AMM 78-31-00/201).
Close the fan cowl panels (Ref. AMM 71-11-04/201).

Remove collar, remove DO-NOT-CLOSE identifier, and close P6 panel ENG START CONTROL circuit breaker opened in step 1. The ENG_T/R IND and ENG_ T/R CONTR breakers associated with the deactivated thrust reverser must remain opened and collared for dispatch.
Damaged or broken drag links must be removed per AMM 78-31-15. Aluminum tape blocker doors shut.
